quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Country and Team
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, country, battier. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Bok-Fu or Bok Fu Do sounds akin to Kung-Fu but it really fits this description.

options.text: It is a type of Chinese Wushu.
It means means to bear a weapon.
It is a Persian martial art.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It translates to White Tiger.

questions.question: Schwingen is considered a national sport in this country and takes this form.

options.text: Austria - grappling without touching the legs

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Switzerland - grappling

questions.question: Which statement is true about Sli Beatha?

options.text: It was founded in 1996 by police officer Craig Smith.
It is performed while brandishing a dirk.
It means face to face combat.
It means stick fighting in Irish martial arts.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was founded in 1996 by police officer Craig Smith.

questions.question: What is specific to the stick fighting known as Istunka?

options.text: It is practiced by herd boys.
It is a martial arts festival in Somalia.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is a martial arts festival in Somalia.

questions.question: Glima sounds like a nasty disease but it really is what?

options.text: acronym for a style of Russian fighting
unarmed combat from the Holy Roman Empire

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Icelandic term for wrestling

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true about the Asian martial art Lethwei?

options.text: It was created by the Chinese community of SE Asia.
It was developed in Hue, Vietnam.
It is a Filipino foot fight.
It is unarmed Burmese martial art.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is unarmed Burmese martial art.

questions.question: Kbach Kun Boran and Kbach Kun Dambong Veng are associated with which country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cambodia

questions.question: Where is the Red Bulls MLS team based?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York

questions.question: What team was Shane Battier selected by in the 2001 NBA draft?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Memphis Grizzlies

questions.question: What did Shane Battier major in at Duke?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Religion

questions.question: Shane Battier appeared on the cover of what video game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: NCAA March Madness 2002

questions.question: Which team was Shane Battier traded to in 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Houston Rockets

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true about Hwa Rang Do in Korea?

options.text: it means The Way of the Flowering Knights
It originated in the kingdom of Gogoryeo
It is a system of 18 techniques.
it is used by members of the Royal Court and traveling monks

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: it means The Way of the Flowering Knights

questions.question: Kajukenbo is not a computer game. What statement best suits this form of martial art?

options.text: It originated on the territory of Hawaii, USA
It was developed by Morihei Ueshiba.
It is the art of espionage.
It means Way of the Sword.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It originated on the territory of Hawaii, USA

questions.question: Tinku sounds like the noise my old car made but its not. What phrase would you connect with this art?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Potosi region of Bolivia

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Test and Series
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, ground, retirement. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Pavel Datsyuk was drafted by the Detroit Red Wings in the 1990s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In the fourth test, at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG), Australian leg-spinner Shane Warne snared his 700th wicket, the first bowler in Test history to do so. Who did he bowl out?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andrew Strauss

questions.question: By scoring 206 runs in the first innings of the second test of the 2006–07 Ashes series, he became only the third Englishman to score a double-century in Australia. Can you name him?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Collingwood

questions.question: Which of these teams did Wayne Gretzky play for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Los Angeles Kings

questions.question: Martin Broduer started his professional career with this ice hockey team.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Jersey Devils

questions.question: In the third Ashes test, Adam Gilchrist’s century in the second innings became the second fastest century in any test match and the fastest in any Ashes test. How many balls did his century score off?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 57

questions.question: The 2006–07 Ashes series was notable for the retirement of several Australian players. Additionally, the Australian coach also announced prior to the Ashes series that the Ashes 2006-07 was his last series of test matches as coach. What was the name of the Australian coach?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Buchanan

questions.question: Which of the following Australian players was NOT playing the last test of his career in the 5th-and the final-test of the 2006-07 Ashes series as Australia concluded the series 5-0?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mathew Hayden

questions.question: Which English batsman took six catches in the first innings of the fourth test of the 2006–07 cricket series, becoming only the third player in Test history to do so?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chris Read

questions.question: In the first innings of the fifth test of the 2006-07 Ashes series, Australia amassed 393 all out. Surprisingly, in the second innings they needed only 46 runs to clinch the final test. By how many wickets did Australia win the match?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 10

questions.question: Which Spanish football team is nicknamed Los Cules, or The Bottoms?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: FC Barcelona

questions.question: In the 2006–07 Ashes series, which batsman took the single winning run as Australia dashed to a 5-0 whitewash against England for the first time in 86 years?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mathew Hayden

questions.question: What is the nickname of the Italian football club Napoli?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Donkey

questions.question: What interesting nickname was given to Spanish football club Atletico Madrid?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mattress Makers

questions.question: Sidney Crosbys Pittsburgh Penguins jersey was the top seller on the NHLs website from September 2005 to February 2008. What number was it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 87

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Bobby Fischer and Nickname

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iceland

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Villarreal

questions.question: What German football club is nicknamed The Hollywood Football Club?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: FC Bayern Munich

questions.question: Bobby Fischer was a member of this church/denomination.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Worldwide Church of God

questions.question: What nickname was given to the Italian football club AC Milan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Devil

questions.question: In what year did Bobby Fischer become the world chess champion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1972

questions.question: Why was Bobby Fischer detained at Narita international airport in Narita, Japan in 2004?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Using a revoked U.S. passport

questions.question: Which English football team has been nicknamed The Pensioners?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chelsea

questions.question: Which Italian football team is known by the nickname Il Grifone, or The Griffin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Genoa

questions.question: What delicious nickname is used to refer to the English football club Everton?

questions.question: In 1992, after 20 years of isolation, Bobby Fischer re-emerged to play a match against this player in Yugoslavia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spassky

questions.question: What is the nickname of the Arsenal F.C. English football club?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Gunners

questions.question: On a radio show in Budapest, Hungary in 1999, Bobby Fischer described himself as a victim of which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An international Jewish conspiracy

questions.question: In 1988 Bobby Fischer filed a U.S. patent for what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a digital chess clock

questions.question: Where was Bobby Fischer born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicago, Illinois

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Pilates and Joseph Pilates
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, apparatus, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: When was the Missouri Tigers first conference championship?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1917-18

questions.question: In what country did Joseph Pilates develop the exercise system Pilates?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Germany

questions.question: In 1984, Bobby Fischer wrote to the editors of this publication to have his name removed from it.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Encyclopedia Judaica

questions.question: Only instructors trained in Pilates and belonging to the Pilates Method Alliance can teach Pilates to the public.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Joseph Pilates used this term to refer to the muscle group comprised of the abs, buttocks, lower back and hips. All the energy begins in this group and flows outward.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Powerhouse

questions.question: Pilates is considered low-impact and is used in physical therapy facilities to rehab injuries.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In Pilates, it is better to do only one perfectly controlled movement rather than 50 sloppy movements.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: When Joseph Pilates moved to England at the age of 32, what did he do for a living?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was a boxer.

questions.question: What is Pilates based on?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yoga and Aerobics

questions.question: Proper breathing is crucial for the blood to circulate and remove wastes related to fatigue. In Pilates, short, quick breathes are advised for maximum positive effect.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Pilates coordinates your movements with which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: your breathing

questions.question: Which of these is not a reported benefit of Pilates?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Decreased appetite

questions.question: Approximately how many people claimed to regularly practice Pilates in the United States according to a 2008 survey?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3,500,000

questions.question: When did Bobby Fischer win the United States Junior Chess Championship?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: July 1956

questions.question: Though not necessary, there are several pieces of apparatus that can be used in a Pilates work out. Which of these is not used in Pilates?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Balance Beam

questions.question: Doug Smiths number was retired by the Missouri Tigers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Why was Tiger Woods nicknamed Tiger when he was younger?

options.text: He got the nickname from a Vietnamese soldier.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He got the nickname from a Vietnamese soldier.

questions.question: Tiger Woods was undoubtedly a child prodigy. At what age did he start playing golf?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Two

options.text: Helping erase poverty and hunger in Africa

questions.question: How is Tiger Woods playing style often described?

questions.question: What religion did Tiger Woods acquire from his mother, Kultida Woods?
